p: In recent years, the interest on the medicinal properties of compounds from Cannabis species has been steadily growing. More than 100 phyto-cannabinoids have been identified from C. sativa; among them, the most potent psychoactive activity is displayed by trans-Î” 9-tetrahydrocannabinol (THC). According to several studies, cannabis derivatives can be useful in conditions such as pain, anorexia-cachexia, skin pathologies, neurodegenerative diseases, epilepsy, sleep disorders and infections. However, legislation regarding these compounds is still ambiguous, insufficient, and plagued by controversies linked to their adverse effects and their consumption as recreational drugs [ 9, 10].
